txt.en:
'If my last task was not too taxing, I am in great need of some assistance from a fellow lover of the written word. I would hope that a [placeholder] of your reputation would be interested in assisting me.  

'Not long ago, I seemed to have misplaced a very important leaf of paper while I was walking with my notes. This paper contains the beginning lines of a story I planned on writing for my children that has been conjuring in my head for some time now. Now that most of the town has been sold off, I have not been able to search for my paper. The last time I tried to have a look around, I was chased off by a group of those ruffians. 

'I would rewrite it, but I cannot seem to recall the exact wording. If you could find it, I would be deeply in your debt. I think I dropped it somewhere in town.'
'I simply cannot start my book without that page. Have you found it yet?\n\n'Ah, I see you have. Many thanks!'
'I know I lost that paper somewhere in Dwaling. It should be just down the hill. Be careful in town with all those ruffians about!'
'I know I dropped that paper somewhere here in Dwaling.'
Ronald Dwale has misplaced an important leaf of paper.
Found the lost leaf of paper
Find the lost leaf of paper
Ronald Dwale remembers dropping his paper somewhere in Dwaling, north of the Bullroarer's Sward.\n\nRonald Dwale has asked you to find his lost leaf of paper.
Ronald Dwale is at Hob Hillbrow's home at the Bullroarer's Sward in Dwaling.\n\nYou should return the leaf of paper to Ronald Dwale.
